p: Leaves of Frangula alnus Mill. and Peganum harmala L. were obtained from populations growing naturally in the Riyadh region of Saudi Arabia. Identification and vouchering were conducted at King Saud University (College of Food and Agricultural Sciences, Hosam0002215-103) by Hosam Elansary. The samples were collected in May 2019 at a temperature ranging from 33 to 23 °C and humidity ranging from 17 to 20%. Sandy soils are common in the collection site, which is close to Al-Thumamah National Park (25°07′ 15″ N 46° 40′ 13″ E, altitude is 632 m above sea level). Methanolic leaf extracts were prepared following [ 24].
